Posts.EditableText: Seeing that a few of the pages on the Axe Software website are created using CGI, Alex, you'd have an answer to my question.  Is CGI hard to learn and use, or do you use a WYSIWYG editor that will do CGI?
Posts.HTML: Seeing that a few of the pages on the Axe Software website are created using CGI, Alex, you'd have an answer to my question.  Is CGI hard to learn and use, or do you use a WYSIWYG editor that will do CGI?

Posts.EditableText: CGI isn't really hard. It's comparable to PHP or perl.
Posts.HTML: CGI isn't really hard. It's comparable to PHP or perl.

Posts.EditableText: The CGI scripts are written in Perl. It's quite easy - plenty of online tutorials. PHP might have been a better choice for a lot of this, with hindsight, but if you can program then it's not "hard".
Posts.HTML: The CGI scripts are written in Perl. It's quite easy - plenty of online tutorials. PHP might have been a better choice for a lot of this, with hindsight, but if you can program then it's not "hard".

Posts.EditableText: thx.  I guess I'll look into it.
Posts.HTML: thx.  I guess I'll look into it.
